snippet: A coalition of insurgents criticized a more radical group’s decision to team up with Al Qaeda’s Iraq branch as a mistake that would benefit only their enemy, President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Leading coalition of Syrian Islamist insurgents break with more radical group Nusra Front, criticizing its alliance with Al Qaeda’s Iraq branch as a moral and political mistake that will benefit only their common enemy, Pres Bashar al-Assad; criticism is most strident yet of  Nusra-Al Qaeda alliance by other members of Syria’s armed opposition.

byline.original: By HANIA MOURTADA and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: A coalition of insurgents criticized a more radical group’s decision to team up with Al Qaeda’s Iraq branch as a mistake that would benefit only their enemy, President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: Syrian Rebels Break With Group Over Qaeda Wing Alliance
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Break With Radical Group Over Alliance With Qaeda Wing
